manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Who is this book for? Harley James Adventures are chapter books written for kids ages 8-12. If your child is into mystery, adventure and maybe intrigued by a bit of history, then these books of perfect for him/her! What are the Harley James Adventure books about? Harley James is the daughter of a famous archeologist who travels around the world. Each book features a new historic location. As an amateur sleuth, Harley must solve a mystery—usually surrounding an important artifact that has been stolen from the dig site. Are the legends in this book real? These books are intended to entertain, but also get kids excited about history! Harley James Adventures are set in real historical sites around the world. Some of the history in the book is true and some has been fictionalized by the author. Go to the Harley James Adventures fan page to learn more from our Fact vs. Fiction series.

A Note from the Author, Leah Cupps Welcome to the World of Harley James Adventures! My daughter was the inspiration behind Harley James. In the summer of 2021, she was watching a documentary series about a lost Mayan city. When I saw her engaged in the story of the Maya, I had an idea. What if we wrote an adventure story together that took place in the famous Mayan city of Tikal? The rest, as they say, is history. After some back and forth banter, we came up with the character of Harley James. She even helped me come up with some of the plot points for the first book. My goal for this series is simple.... to get kids excited about reading! And if they get a little spark of interest in history? Even better. Enjoy the adventure, Leah Cupps

Harley James & the Peril of the Pirate's Curse Harley James and the Secret of the Falcon Queen Harley James and the Puzzle in Paris Harley James Adventures Join Harley and her friends as they swashbuckle their way through the mysterious Port Royal, Jamaica—the famous sunken pirate city of the Caribbean! Harley and her friends race against time to keep the Queen’s secret… a secret that has been kept for a thousand years in a mysterious castle in Scotland. Follow along as Harley and Veronica navigate the hidden world beneath Paris, find a secret map of the mysterious tombs, solve some serious puzzles and riddles, and prevent Albert Monet from raising the bones of the catacombs back from the dead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must have in all classrooms
reviews.reviewText: If you like Indiana Jones, you will love Harley James. A story taking place in the remote and exotic jungles of Guatemala. The story is a fun to read page turner that will keep your children/students looking for more mystery and adventure. As a teacher, the idea of having (fun) by using the stories settings and plots to teach about culture and the past to my students. All-in-all, I think all upper elementary and middle schools should have copies of Harley James for the above reasons.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cute enough, but...
reviews.reviewText: I've never seen a book with so many typos and mistakes. I was really surprised to see numerous editing mistakes, which bug me because it's just careless on the part of the editor. Otherwise an okay story; we read it together and my 9 year old seemed to enjoy it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Full of twists and turns keeps you riveted wondering what’s around the next corner
reviews.reviewText: It felt like you were there in the jungle with Harley James. You could almost smell the musky vegetation. Such a descriptive free flowing writing style. It was like being pulled down a fast moving river, never knowing what was around the next corner. Even though it was fiction it had many real elements of the Mayan culture woven into a thrilling adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well written and impossible to put down!
reviews.reviewText: Leah's writing style flows smoothly as she brings the characters to life. The exotic locations almost pop from the pages. You will enjoy being transported to Harley's side as she takes you from one book-gripping adventure to the next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what my daughter was looking for in a book!
reviews.reviewText: This is exactly what my daughter was looking for… mystery, fun facts, and mythology! The heroine, Harley, takes you on a journey that proves with some knowledge, logic, and heart you can accomplish anything. My daughter and her friends (boys and girls) loved this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This was such a fun middle grade adventure. Harley is a smart, really clever, and brave MC that is definitely a good role model for younger kids (minus the sneaking out of course 😂). I also like her friend Aly, who is the best type of friend!The adventure was fun and quick paced and learning about Mayan culture while reading was interesting too. The plot twist actually got me, I had no idea until just before it was revealed. Definitely a great book for young readers!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Whole Family Fun
reviews.reviewText: It’s a rare day when our whole family gathers around a book to hear what happens next in the plot. This book is a winner! We all are invested in the characters and plot. I highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good gift for Neice
reviews.reviewText: My Neice loved reading it. Perfect gift
A great mysterious adventure. I read it along with my ten year old daughter and we both enjoyed it very much.
Riddles to be solved. Adventure to be sought. Fun to be had.Illustrations add to energy of this fast-moving story.Really like the main character, she’s curious, outgoing and bright.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: It was very good! I'm pleased that Harley found the statue and her sister got arrested,I never liked her much

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: It is a good and interesting book for young readers, with quick action and interesting plot.
